title: fennic
author: fennic
content: Today I was wondering that if I am correct than Bitcointalk was created in 2009, and mostly Satoshi was the owner and than he or his organization has been Ghosted and it's account is offline. So I was wondering that who pays Domain Name service fee per year. And it could not be free. And still how this website is running?

comments.author: Mr.right85
comments.body: The website or forum works on an Simple Machine Forum (SMF) software, providing messaging services for the bulk of forum users.Although Satoshi Nakamoto might have ghost out on the forum as we hope to believe or perhaps he or she or group is here with us with another name, one thing we know for sure is that, the forum still has its management that runs it in the person of Theymos. We've also got Cyrus to help, along with a host of other admins.The forum has a way of generating income and so, running itself or having funds to run the forum is a no question. It has a good enough traffic on it too.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Either Theymos or Cyrus pays the fees. Not really sure which one of them. Not that it matters though because 1) they have hundreds of Bitcoin to pay it off with and 2) the domain is likely paid for several years in advance.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: The forum doesn't host itself too, it's hosted by aws (amazon Web services) afaik and also has protection from cloud flare. Both of these being run on the forum will make the fees paid for domain renewals seem extremely tiny.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: In addition to the posts above the expenses for the domain and hosting of this forum came from donations and ads. The bitcointalk.org domain name is similarly controlled by Cobra, while I administrate the site.2018:Quote from: theymos on April 08, 2018, 09:41:45 PM Bitcoin.org: - Cobra has ultimate control over the domain name. I have access to the domain name settings. - Cobra runs the server. - Will Binns holds the BTC. Bitcointalk.org: - Cobra has ultimate control over the domain name. I have access to the domain name settings. - I run the server. Cobra has no access to the database or server. - The BTC is held by myself and the treasurers. Cobra has no access. I am not Cobra. What would even be the point of that? 2019:Quote from: theymos on April 09, 2019, 05:05:22 AMIt's surprising how well-documented history can become totally forgotten... Satoshi created the forum on Nov 22, 2009, and was head administrator until almost 2011. Then Sirius was head administrator until 2012, which is when I took over.Cobra also owns the bitcointalk.org domain name. I consider the forum to be basically owned by or at least dedicated to the Bitcoin community, though; I don't call anyone an owner of the forum.So regarding the question, who pays for the bitcointalk.org domain? Of course the owner and that means Cobra should be paying for the domain name fee.Next question who's paying for the hosting, SSL and cloudflare etc then answer is theymos, since theymos is the ultimate administrator of the forum then he should be paying all the expense and remember forum have enough funds in BTC to support the forum until 2140.Just to give you an idea, not a single bitcoin satoshi has been spent from this stash of 1250 BTC since 2013 https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=155000.0 now imagine and be proud of how rich our forum is.After 2140 Satoshi will take over everything.Edit: Thanks to @tranthidung2020:Quote from: theymos on April 17, 2020, 07:13:47 PMCøbra no longer has any access to the bitcointalk.org domain name. Conclusion: Everything (finance/administration etc) related to bitcointalk.org is under theymos, he doin it on behalf of the Bitcoin Community If theymos disappears?Quote from: theymos on May 26, 2019, 12:07:11 AMShould I disappear, Cyrus and/or others-I've-established will take over day-to-day operations and decision-making. You and the non-profit organization would act as checks upon them and each other to ensure that the forum doesn't just turn into some business, but would continue to have a "soul".

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: fennic on December 20, 2022, 02:35:31 PMSo I was wondering that who pays Domain Name service fee per year. And it could not be free. And still how this website is running?There are many mods/admins on the site, didn't you wonder how they were chosen, how are they paid? And who appointed them?Hosting fees is more than Domain Name service fee, BTT has many signature campaigns that pay more than a thousand dollars per week means that the cost of the site is much higher than the domain renewal fee.The site also serves a paid service (copper account,) which is greater than the domain fee.Also, the site can ask for donations, which I am sure will be higher than the domain renewal fee.So it is not a problem.The problem is hosting fees, website development, keeping spam low, taxes etc, and the forum has enough coins to cover that.

comments.author: drwhobox
comments.body: Whoever buys the domain is surely not bought for a year . Probably the domain has been bought for a long period, and it is clear that the mods who are controlling the forum has access to the admin panel or developer panel, where they can run the site and take care of all the website-related activity needed to run the site. Satoshi is not ghosted. He planned everything so well that after 13 years, the site is running like butter. The group of people who are running the site is taking care of the domain and hosting renewal too, and one thing I can say is that Theymos himself is the leader of that group.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: I am not sure of how much it will cost for the owner to pay the domain fee per year or even pay in advance to avoid interruptions. Let's put that aside since there's a reply or post about who will pay the domain fee per year which is already obvious who will pay for it either the owner, co-owner or both of them will/might pay for the domain fee per year. The question is, who is/are the owner of the said domain name as of now?. The answer is what shahzadafzal posted and also what tranthidung posted. My opinion is that the money that will be use to pay may came from what the forum received when a forum user buy copper membership status.
